visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color for the title, labels, and axes with a font size of 14px. Data series: The data series should include monthly average temperatures for a year, with the series name 'Temperature'. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color, add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with a title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart type is set to 'spline', and the background color is a light gray (#f0f0f0). The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to provide ample space around the chart. The title and axes labels are styled with a dark blue color (#00008B) and a font size of 14px. The x-axis has a tick interval of 5, and the y-axis title is set to 'Temperature (°C)'. The data series includes monthly average temperatures for a year, with the series name 'Temperature'. The series color is a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#00008B). Additionally, a legend is added at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally.
